habitat_description:
Northwest:
This species occurs north of the San Franciso Bay area to the North Coast and Klamath ranges of northern California at elevations up to 1830 meters. It is a common resident of open forest, chapparal, brushy clearings and streamside thickets, preferring dense shrubby stages of digger pine, oak, black oak woodlands, and ponserosa pine forest. It can be found in and around downed logs, stumps and rocky environs of Douglas fir, white fir redwood, incense cedar, madrone, mazanita, ceanothus, and serviceberry ([Harvey and Polite 2007] based on Zeiner et al. 1990, Inlges 1965, Burt and Grossenheider 1976, Wilson and Ruff 1999, Johnson 1943).
